title: Understanding the Functions and Graph
text:
$$lim_x$$ → -4**- f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from the left.
$$lim_x$$ → -4**+ f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from the right.
$$lim_x$$ → $$-4$$ f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from both sides.
$$f(-4)$$ is the value of f(x) when $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$.
Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x).
